description: The Chicago City Council approved an approximately $17 billion budget for 2025 that raises levies and fees by about $256 million after Mayor Brandon Johnson removed his proposed property tax hike.
title: Chicago Officials Approve 2025 Budget Without Property Tax Hike

description: Yoon Suk Yeol’s turmoil in Seoul, the weakest government in decades in Tokyo and Donald Trump’s return to power in Washington means a brief moment of coordination is coming to an end at the worst possible time.
title: Yoon's Impeachment Widens East Asia Fault Lines

description: Trump’s choice to run US government finance was part of the Soros team that crashed the pound. His new reality is more complex than any exchange-rate wager.
title: Debt Risks That Lured Bessent to US Treasury Now Loom Large

description: TikTok CEO Shou Chew met with president-elect Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago on Monday just weeks before the popular video app is expected to be banned in the US over national security concerns.
title: TikTok CEO Chew Met Trump at Mar-a-Lago Ahead of US Ban

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, international economics and security reporter Eric Martin details the discussions already underway with other nations to accept migrants that President-elect Donald Trump wants to deport. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Team Already in Backchannel Talks on Deportations

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he planned legal action against the Biden administration to stop the sale of unused materials to build the incomplete wall on the Mexico border.
title: Trump Threatens Legal Action Over Sale of Border Wall Materials

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s transition team has reached out to the governments of Mexico and El Salvador through back channels about taking in some of the millions of undocumented migrants set to be expelled under his mass deportation plan, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Trump Team Backchannels With Mexico, El Salvador on Deportations

description: Weeks before Donald Trump returns to the White House, China’s factories are expanding production abroad and growing their customer base outside the US as they gird for new levies from the self-proclaimed “tariff man.”
title: China’s Factories Seek to Trump-Proof Business by Going Global

description: Ken Griffin, the billionaire founder of the Citadel financial empire, plans to give $1 million to President-elect Donald Trump’s inaugural fund after declining to donate to his campaign during this year’s race.
title: Ken Griffin Plans to Donate $1 Million for Trump’s Inauguration

description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is meeting with Republican senators who are seeking to better understand his views on abortion and vaccine policy as he courts their support this week for his nomination to the top role at the Department of Health and Human Services.
title: RFK Jr. Courts Republicans in Effort to Secure Top Health Job

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will name Dominic LeBlanc as Canada’s finance minister to replace Chrystia Freeland, who shocked the government with a scathing resignation letter on Monday morning.
title: Trudeau to Name LeBlanc Canada Finance Minister With Government in Chaos

description: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem said Donald Trump’s trade threats are making the world a more uncertain place, and urged advanced countries to work together to bolster economic security.
title: Macklem Says Trump Tariffs Cloud Outlook, Urges G-7 Cooperation

description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum is supporting a proposal to reform the law regulating the government-backed mortgage lender Infonavit, that will greatly expand its capabilities, eliminate a raft of checks and balances to give her administration full power over its decision making.
title: Mexico Government Moves to Expand Its Powers in Housing Agency

description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson is reversing his plan to raise property taxes by offering to use some bond refinancing savings and defer a loan repayment to close the budget deficit.
title: Chicago Nixes Property-Tax Hike as Olympic Loan Payment Extended

description: Argentina is weighing whether to introduce a managed exchange rate regime — a “dirty float” — once it lifts its current foreign exchange controls in 2025, according to policymakers.
title: Argentina Weighs Managed Exchange Rate Once It Lifts Currency Controls

description: President-elect Donald Trump said Ukraine needs to reach a deal to end the Russian invasion and downplayed the value of occupied land, in the latest signal he may push for a settlement that codifies Russian territorial gains.
title: Trump Says Zelenskiy Should Prepare to Make Deal to End War

description: The French National Assembly unanimously adopted a stopgap budget bill intended to enable the state to keep functioning from January.
title: French Lawmakers Adopt Stopgap Budget Bill After Barnier Ouster

description: Germany is headed for months of political deadlock as voters return to the ballot box for another federal election in February and with coalition negotiations potentially lasting several months after that.
title: Germany Faces Policy Gridlock as Campaign Season Heats Up

description: Germany’s conservatives are ready to abolish a contentious levy charged on natural gas supplies in storage, breaking a week-long political standstill over the fee that had raised alarm among European neighbors.
title: German Conservatives Agree to Scrap Contentious Gas Storage Fee

description: Donald Trump said he’s being embraced by business executives — in a stark reversal from when he first won the White House eight years ago — as tech executives and founders flock to Florida to meet with the president-elect.
title: ‘Everybody Wants To Be My Friend,’ Trump Says of CEOs

description: The Bank of France cut its domestic growth outlook just days after President Emmanuel Macron named the country’s fourth prime minister in a year, with the central bank citing the political upheaval as a drag on household and business confidence.
title: France’s Growth Prospects Weaken as Political Uncertainty Weighs

description: The Dutch government will block Serbia from progressing further in its talks toward future membership in the European Union, according to its foreign minister.
title: Netherlands Will Block Serbia’s Next Step Toward EU Accession

description: President-elect Donald Trump suggested the US government knows the source of mystery drone sightings in New Jersey and New York, fueling questions about the incidents as federal officials insist there’s no evidence of security risks.
title: Trump Says US Military Keeping Public in ‘Suspense’ on Drones

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he didn’t expect Florida Governor Ron DeSantis to appoint his daughter-in-law, Lara Trump, to replace Marco Rubio, his nominee as Secretary of State, to represent the state in the US Senate.
title: Trump Doesn’t See DeSantis Appointing Daughter-in-Law to Senate

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he’d consider pardoning New York Mayor Eric Adams after he was indicted this fall on bribery and fraud charges.
title: Trump Says He’d Consider Pardoning NYC Mayor Eric Adams

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he would take a look at whether to stave off a looming ban of TikTok Inc., reversing the hard-line stance he took against the Chinese-owned video sharing app when he was president in 2020.
title: Trump Signals Openness to Stopping TikTok Ban, Softening Stance

description: Switzerland’s government has been ordered by parliament to step in with aid to help the country’s ailing steel industry, in a break with its traditional hands-off approach to business.
title: Swiss Steel Aid Draws Closer in Departure From Hands-Off Policy

description: The demise of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s repressive regime in early December was achieved by a surprise push into the capital Damascus led by a group of Islamist rebels. The group, Hayat Tahrir Al-Sham, which grew out of the radical al-Qaeda organization, has declared an interim government to administer areas under its control.
title: After the Victory of Islamist Rebels, What’s Next for Syria?

description: President-elect Donald Trump threatened to fire federal employees who don’t come back to the office, and said he would go to court to challenge a Biden administration labor contract that locked in remote work arrangements for thousands of federal employees.
title: Trump Vows to Fire Federal Employees Who Don’t Return to Office

description: The US Supreme Court refused to hear an appeal from Peter Navarro, the formerly imprisoned official whom President-elect Donald Trump has tapped to be his senior counselor for trade and manufacturing.
title: Navarro Turned Away by Supreme Court on Presidential Records

description: North Korean soldiers are starting to sustain heavy losses against Ukrainian troops fighting in Russia’s Kursk region as the Kremlin intensifies its campaign to regain control of the lost territory.
title: Kyiv Sees Rising Death Toll From North Koreans Fighting in Kursk

description: US Representative Mikie Sherrill of New Jersey, a former Navy helicopter aircraft commander, called on the Biden administration to develop a coordinated response to the mysterious drone sightings that have rattled residents of the Garden State.
title: Drone Response Should Be Led by NORAD, NJ Congresswoman Says

description: South Africa’s president said he will soon set up a panel that will provide advice on a national dialogue that will be held next year on the country’s future development path.
title: South Africa to Set Up Panel to Advise on National Dialogue

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams’ reelection bid was dealt a severe blow after the city’s campaign finance board denied him millions of dollars in public matching funds.
title: NYC’s Adams Loses Bid for Public Matching Funds for 2025 Race

description: The US Treasury Department on Monday sanctioned nine people and seven entities for providing financial and military support to North Korea, which it said are used for its ballistic missile program and backing Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: US Issues Sanctions Related to North Korean Missiles, Russia Aid

description: German lawmakers passed a measure that will pave the way for a national election in two months, backing Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s plan to end his embattled administration early.
title: German Parliament Clears Path for Early Election in February

description: Attempts by four pro-European Romanian parties to form a coalition government and dial down political turbulence hit a hurdle over disputes on trimming the European Union’s widest budget deficit.
title: Talks on New Romanian Government Hit First Snag on Budget Plan

description: Former New York Lieutenant Governor Brian Benjamin must stand trial on bribery charges after the US Supreme Court refused to dismiss three counts alleging he took corrupt campaign donations from a real estate developer.
title: Supreme Court Spurns Ex-NY Lieutenant Governor on Bribery Counts

description: Canadian Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland resigned from Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s cabinet over differences in how to prepare for the Trump administration, a stunning move that shakes the government.
title: Canada Finance Minister Freeland Resigns Amid Rift Over Trump

description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has a new ambition for the Lone Star State: surpassing France as one of the world’s largest economies.
title: Texas Economy Will Top France’s Thanks to Trump, Abbott Says

description: Russia’s army recruited more than 430,000 new troops this year amid its war in Ukraine, President Vladimir Putin said.
title: Putin Says Russia Recruited More Than 430,000 to Army This Year

description: Daily threats to fire the attorney general. Stopping the scheduled appointment of a chief justice because he’s a liberal. Replacing legal overseers in government ministries. Restricting who runs for office in a way more likely to affect Arabs.
title: Netanyahu Tries Again to Boost His Power After Military Wins

description: Germany’s finance ministry announced plans to implement a provisional budget at the start of 2025. The move comes after the collapse of Olaf Scholz’s three-party coalition and as the country prepares for elections in February.
title: Germany Enacts Provisional Budget for 2025 Before Snap Elections

description: The departure of Russia’s military from Syria should be a precondition for lifting European Union sanctions against the rebel group that took power in Damascus, according to the Dutch foreign minister.
title: Russia Should Leave Syria Before EU Sanctions Lifted, Dutch Say

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz called for massive new investment into infrastructure and defense, hitting on key campaign themes ahead of a vote in parliament on Monday that will pave the way for a snap federal election in just over two months.
title: Scholz Vows Investment Boom as Germany Heads for an Election

description: Keir Starmer’s efforts to boost ties with Beijing have come under fresh scrutiny after a Chinese businessman with close links to Prince Andrew was barred from the UK on national security grounds.
title: A Royal Row Over Spying Poses Challenge for Starmer on China

description: The European Union is suing the UK at the bloc’s top court for the way it limited the rights of EU citizens and their family members to live and work in Britain following Brexit.
title: EU Takes UK to Court Over Freedom of Movement for Bloc’s Citizens

description: The European Union is committing to build a €10.6 billion ($11.13 billion) constellation of satellites that will provide the bloc with encrypted global internet connectivity in a bid to provide a homegrown alternative to Elon Musk’s Starlink.
title: EU Plans $11 Billion in Satellites in Counter to Musk’s Starlink

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: China May Relish a Change at the Top in South Korea

description: Bucharest Mayor Nicusor Dan is planning to run for presidency as an independent during an election re-run next year, G4Media reports, citing unidentified people with the knowledge of his plans.
title: Bucharest Mayor Dan to Run for Romanian Presidency, G4Media Says

description: France’s new Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s meeting with Marine Le Pen on Monday left the far-right leader “more positive” on his method, even if she said it wasn’t clear yet if the talks were useful.
title: Le Pen Says She’s ‘More Positive’ After Meeting French Premier

description: Vietnam has released details of a master plan to shrink government by merging ministries and eliminating the number of their units by “at least 15%-20%” in a move to redirect funds away from bureaucracy to development projects.
title: Vietnam Plans to Merge Ministries, Cut State Workers in Overhaul

description: The Chinese Foreign Ministry said the country’s actions have all been “above board” after a Chinese businessman with close links to British royal Prince Andrew was barred from the UK over security concerns.
title: China Rejects Spy Allegations in UK as ‘Baseless Narratives’

description: Opposition lawmakers in Taiwan pushed forward legal changes that would make it harder to recall elected officials and representatives, a contentious move that would help them secure a legislative majority they’ve used to take on President Lai Ching-te.
title: Taiwan Opposition Advances Legal Changes to Make Recalls Harder

description: European Union nations on Monday will discuss preparations for the winter with the gas transit agreement between Russia and Ukraine set to expire and the bloc trying to phase out reliance on fossil fuels from Moscow.
title: EU to Tackle Energy Security as Ukraine Transit Deal Nears End

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will submit to a parliamentary vote of confidence on Monday that he has every intention of losing to trigger a snap election on Feb. 23. Here’s what you need to know:
title: German Chancellor Scholz Faces Confidence Vote: What to Expect

description: New Zealand’s government is urging local councils to focus on core tasks and not direct scarce funds to convention centers or projects that central government is responsible for.
title: New Zealand Plans Reforms to Focus Local Councils on Core Role

description: Bangladesh plans to hold national election between the end of 2025 and the first half of 2026, its interim leader said, making it the first time his administration has provided a roadmap on polls after the nation was thrown into political turmoil earlier this year.
title: Bangladesh Leader Says Election Possible by Late Next Year

description: Thailand will host an informal meeting of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations this week to discuss the latest situation in strife-torn Myanmar and the way forward.
title: Thailand to Host Informal Talks on Strife-Torn Myanmar This Week

description: South Korea’s Constitutional Court has started reviewing President Yoon Suk Yeol’s impeachment case, while investigators reportedly plan to question him this week over his shock martial law declaration.
title: South Korean Court Starts Review of Yoon’s Impeachment Case

description: Canadian Housing Minister Sean Fraser is resigning from cabinet and doesn’t plan to run in the next election, a move that comes as Justin Trudeau’s Liberal Party languishes in the polls with an election looming in 2025.
title: Canada’s Housing Minister Resigns From Trudeau’s Cabinet

description: Brazil’s interest rates are too high, and responsibility for the growing fiscal problems lies with policymakers at the central bank, President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said Sunday night in a TV interview.
title: Lula Says the Only Thing Wrong With Brazil Is High Rates

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping dismissed internal divisions within the ruling Communist Party as unavoidable, while calling for greater efforts to instill discipline, according to newly disclosed remarks he made at an anti-graft meeting in January.
title: Xi Says ‘Inevitable’ for Ruling Party to Have Internal Conflicts

description: President Yoon Suk Yeol’s demise may have been swift and shocking, but he is just the latest in a growing list of South Korean leaders who’ve seen their fortunes turn after rising to power.
title: Yoon Joins Growing List of Disgraced South Korean Presidents

description: UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves is resisting calls from English mayors to extend their revenue-raising abilities, an awkward clash that comes as her government launches its plan to extend more powers to local leaders.
title: Reeves Blocks Calls From English Mayors for More Tax Powers

description: Business between the UK and India has boomed this year as firms in both countries anticipate their governments will be able to seal a free trade agreement, HSBC Holdings Plc data showed.
title: UK-India Business Boosted By Prospect of Trade Deal, HSBC Says
